In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution to your problem using Julia DataFrames package. This code assumes you have the required packages installed and imported into your script/notebook. If not, you can use Pkg.add("DataFrames") to install it.

```julia
using DataFrames
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```
This function takes a dataframe `df` and adds a new column `ym` to it based on the year and month of each DateTime in `dt`. The new column is an integer representing the year and month (in format "yyyymm") of each date. 

You can use it like this:
```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=[Date(2022,1,1), Date(2023,2,15), Date(2024,3,31)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
